See Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 210.
_description: A Holly and Ivy carol turned into a love lyric, ascribed to Henry VIII — four cross-rhymed quatrains (abab) with a 4-line burden: ‘Grene growith the holy / So doth the iue / Thow wynter blastys blow neuer so hye / Grene growth the holy.’

BLAdd31922.First Lines: As the holy grouth grene and neuer chaungyth hewSo I am euer hath bene vnto my lady trew…
BLAdd31922.Last Lines: …Adew myne owne lady Adew my specyallWho hath my hart trewly be suere and euer shall
BLAdd31922.Note: Burden repeated three times with notes on f. 37v for various singing parts.
